synthesis.method: Electrospinning followed by pre-oxidation and carbonization
synthesis.precursors: Fe, Co, Ni, Cr, Mn metal salts dissolved in PAN/DMF solution

XPS.peak_shift: Binding energy shifts for Fe, Co, Ni, Cr, and Mn due to alloying and oxidation

physicochemical_characterization.HAADF-STEM: Uniform distribution of the metal elements in HEA nanocrystals
physicochemical_characterization.EDX_maps: Uniform distribution of Fe, Co, Ni, Cr, Mn in nanocrystals

electrochemical_performance.mass_activity_A_mg: Not explicitly mentioned, but significantly higher for FeCoNiCrMn compared to other MEAs
electrochemical_performance.stability: Stable for 20 hours at 10 mA/cm² with minimal degradation

theoretical_computations.reaction_mechanism: Operando Raman spectroscopy indicates that electron transfer from low-electronegativity metals (Fe, Ni, Cr, Mn) to Co creates a local negative charge center on Co sites, weakening the OH bond and lowering its adsorption energy.
